channel.title: NPR Programs: Morning Edition
channel.description: Morning Edition takes listeners around the country and the world with multi-faceted stories and commentaries every weekday. Hosts Steve Inskeep, Leila Fadel, Michel Martin and A Martínez bring you the latest breaking news and features to prepare you for the day.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: House expected to vote on bill to release the Epstein files
item.description: The House is expected to vote Tuesday on a bill to compel the Department of Justice to release files related to convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein.
item.content:encoded: The House is expected to vote Tuesday on a bill to compel the Department of Justice to release files related to convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein.
item.dc:creator: Barbara Sprunt

item.title: Could the DOJ's probe into Epstein's ties to political foes stop the files' release?
item.description: NPR's Steve Inskeep speaks with former U.S. attorney Joyce Vance about whether the Justice Department's probe into Democrats' ties to Jeffrey Epstein will affect the potential release of the files.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Steve Inskeep speaks with former U.S. attorney Joyce Vance about whether the Justice Department's probe into Democrats' ties to Jeffrey Epstein will affect the potential release of the files.
item.dc:creator: Steve Inskeep

item.title: Morning news brief
item.description: The House will vote Tuesday on a bill to release the Epstein files, the Epstein files reveal fractures in Trump's MAGA coalition, Saudi crown prince to will visit the White House Tuesday.
item.content:encoded: The House will vote Tuesday on a bill to release the Epstein files, the Epstein files reveal fractures in Trump's MAGA coalition, Saudi crown prince to will visit the White House Tuesday.
item.dc:creator: Steve Inskeep

item.title: Illinois pushes ahead on clean energy jobs after Trump disrupts predecessor's plans
item.description: President Trump scrambled his predecessor's plans to lift up American workers by generating clean energy jobs. Despite major policy shifts, Illinois is still trying to make that happen.
item.content:encoded: President Trump scrambled his predecessor's plans to lift up American workers by generating clean energy jobs. Despite major policy shifts, Illinois is still trying to make that happen.
item.dc:creator: Andrea Hsu

item.title: National nonprofit Lasagna Love still filling food requests despite shutdown's end
item.description: Lasagna Love, a national nonprofit that offers free lasagnas, saw requests for help jump after the pause in SNAP benefits. Despite the shutdown's end, the need for help still remains.
item.content:encoded: Lasagna Love, a national nonprofit that offers free lasagnas, saw requests for help jump after the pause in SNAP benefits. Despite the shutdown's end, the need for help still remains.
item.dc:creator: Macy Lipkin

item.title: ProPublica reporter on the high-profile raid of a Chicago apartment building
item.description: NPR's Leila Fadel speaks to ProPublica reporter Melissa Sanchez, who fact-checked the Trump administration's claims about a high-profile immigration raid in Chicago.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Leila Fadel speaks to ProPublica reporter Melissa Sanchez, who fact-checked the Trump administration's claims about a high-profile immigration raid in Chicago.
item.dc:creator: Leila Fadel

item.title: Britain unveils plan to overhaul its asylum system
item.description: Britain's government announced plans Monday to overhaul its asylum laws. Among the changes: making refugee status temporary and seizing high-value assets from asylum seekers.
item.content:encoded: Britain's government announced plans Monday to overhaul its asylum laws. Among the changes: making refugee status temporary and seizing high-value assets from asylum seekers.
item.dc:creator: Fatima Al-Kassab

item.title: After a mental health break, Lewis Capaldi returns with a new EP 'Survive'
item.description: After taking a break for his mental health, Scottish singer-songwriter Lewis Capaldi is back with a new EP called "Survive." Leila Fadel talks with him about returning to the stage.
item.content:encoded: After taking a break for his mental health, Scottish singer-songwriter Lewis Capaldi is back with a new EP called "Survive." Leila Fadel talks with him about returning to the stage.
item.dc:creator: Leila Fadel

item.title: Rising costs and red tape force home childcare centers across the country to close
item.description: In some states, more and more home childcare centers and nursery schools are shutting down. The problem -- rising costs and mounds of red tape.
item.content:encoded: In some states, more and more home childcare centers and nursery schools are shutting down. The problem -- rising costs and mounds of red tape.
item.dc:creator: Hannah Yang

item.title: The Epstein files are just the latest fracture hitting Trump's MAGA coalition
item.description: Even before the president's falling out with Rep. Marjorie Taylor Greene, R-Ga., over the Epstein files, some Republicans questioned Trump's policy interpretation of what "America First" means.
item.content:encoded:
Even before the president's falling out with Rep. Marjorie Taylor Greene, R-Ga., over the Epstein files, some Republicans questioned Trump's policy interpretation of what "America First" means.

(Image credit: Elijah Nouvelage)
item.dc:creator: Stephen Fowler
